title: Hiring freeze
description: Order from the mayor's office to submit justification for future hires.

title: New fire chief
description: Lurie named Battalion Chief Dean Crispen as new Fire Chief.

title: New police commissioner
description: Lurie appointed Wilson Leung to the police commission.

title: New Prop. E commissioner
description: Lurie appointed Jean Fraser to Prop. E commission, the task force to streamline the city's boards and commissions.

title: New MTC appointment
description: Lurie appointed Alicia Jean-Baptiste to the MTC.

title: Two health commissioners reappointed
description: Lurie reappointed Tessie Guillermo and Dr. Laurie Green to the Health Commission.

title: SAFE Streets Act
description: Wiener and Lurie proposed state bill that allows local police to enforce fencing operations of suspected stolen goods on Mission Street and the rest of the city.

title: Fentanyl ordinance
description: An ordinance passed the Board of Supervisors to streamline contracting to address homelessness, drug abuse mental health needs and related problems.
sponsor: Daniel Lurie, Matt Dorsey, Joel Engardio, Stephen Sherrill, Bilal Mahmood, Rafael Mandelman, Danny Sauter

title: SFPD Hospitality Task Force
description: Lurie launched hospitality task force to centralize police resources around Yerba Buena Gardens, Moscone Center and Union Square.

title: Renewal of two programs aimed at Black students
description: Lurie renewed Opportunities for All and Black 2 San Francisco programs.

title: New fire commissioners
description: Lurie appointed Allan Low to the fire commission and reappointed Marcy Fraser.

title: SFPD Sixth Street Triage Center
description: The San Francisco Police Department set up a triage center on Sixth Street, a one-stop-shop for arrests, drug treatment and homeless busing.

title: State transit funding
description: Lurie went to Sacramento to lobby for stopgap funding to support the city's transit agencies.

title: New public health director
description: Lurie made Daniel Tsai Director of Public Health.

title: Stabilization center
description: Lurie announced a plan to open a behavioural health facility at 822 Geary in April. (Plans to operate the site were initiated under the previous administration.)
tags: public safety, homelessness, public health, initiative

title: Permit reform
description: Lurie announced "PermitSF," a plan to reform permitting process by next year.

title: SFMTA board appointment
description: Lurie appointed Alfonso Felder to SFMTA Board.

title: Nightlife venues
description: Lurie and Wiener introduced State legislation SB 395 to spur creation of new nightlife venues.

title: New SFMTA director
description: Lurie appointed Julie Kirschbaum as Director of Transportation at the SFMTA.

title: SFPD overtime funding
description: Lurie sought $61 million in overtime funding for the San Francisco Police Department, despite reported abuse of the department's overtime policy from a city audit.

title: Removal of Max Carter Oberstone from the Police Commission
description: Max Carter-Oberstone was removed from the Police Commission following a directive from the mayor and a 9-2 vote from the Board of Supervisors.

title: Office to housing conversion
description: Lurie and supes introduced legislation aimed at facilitating office to housing conversions.
sponsor: Daniel Lurie, Matt Dorsey, Danny Sauter

title: Multi-agency raid at Jefferson Square Park
description: The San Francisco Police Department, Sheriff's Department and other agencies raided Jefferson Square Park to crack down on drug activity. Over 80 arrests were made, but according to reporting from the San Francisco Standard, only three were detained on drug dealing charges.

title: New police commissioner
description: Lurie appointed Mattie Scott to police commission.

title: Program to prevent family homelessness
description: Lurie launched $11 million program with Tipping Point to support families with cash and services.

title: 16th BART Plaza command van
description: The San Francisco Police Department mobilized a command unit at the 16th Street BART plaza.

title: First year free
description: Lurie renewed first year free program to waive fees and permits for the first year of business.

title: Cole Valley Entertainment Zone
description: Lurie celebrated the launch of the new Cole Valley Entertainment Zone, which was created following the mayor's legislation from February 7, 2025.

title: Waymo airport mapping
description: Lurie gave Waymo the green light to start mapping the roadways at SFO airport.

title: New library commissioners
description: Lurie appointed Dr. Shawn Calhoun and Whitney Jones to join the Library Commission, and reappoints Pete Huang.

title: Reappointment to Human Services Commission
description: Lurie reappointed Dr. James McCray to the Human Services Commission.

title: "Breaking the Cycle"
description: Lurie signed executive directive to outline a roadmap with immediate actions and longer-term reforms that will tackle the enduring homelessness and behavioural health crises.

title: Police intervention at Van Ness Avenue and Market Street
description: San Francisco Police Department officers engaged in a raid at Van Ness Avenue and Market Streets and arrest 40 people. Subsequently, no one was charged.

title: Muni fundraising committee
description: Lurie registered a ballot measure committee to raise money for Muni.

title: Speed cameras
description: Lurie launched San Francisco's automated speed camera enforcement program, with speed cameras to operate at 33 locations in the city. The program is a result of the passage of Assembly Bill 645.

title: $36M community funding
description: Lurie announced a $36 million funding opportunity through the Human Rights Commission for community-serving organizations.

title: Integrated street teams
description: Lurie announced new street team response model, which consolidates department resources into unified teams assigned to different geographic areas.

title: Safe drug supplies
description: Lurie announced that the city will prohibit the distribution of safe drug use supplies, unless the outfits distributing them offer counseling services or connections to care.

title: Jerold Avenue shelter expansion
description: Lurie announced shelter expansion at 2177 Jerold Ave. in Bayview, which includes the addition of 68 shelter beds. The move was criticized by District 10 Supervisor Shamann Walton, who said that the district houses a disproportionate share of the city's homelessness services.

title: Family zoning
description: The San Francisco Planning Department and the mayor's office unveiled a new "family zoning plan" proposal to increase building height limits across the Westside, and remove density limits.

title: Entertainment zones
description: Lurie announced the creation of five new entertainment zones. The zones are: Valencia Street; Pier 39; Ellis Street between Stockton and Powell streets; Folsom Street between Seventh and Eighth streets; and Yerba Buena Lane between Market and Mission streets, and at Jessie Square.

title: Waymo on Market Street
description: Lurie welcomed Waymo to Market Street: The autonomous vehicle company will begin mapping the corridor.
